result.execSummary:
The defendant Marquise M Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marquise M Smith in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Defendant Marquise M Smith in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin. sdg
State reports that Defendant has picked up a new case.  State requests that the DPA be revoked and to proceed to Sentencing.   The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.
Court sentenced defendant to serve 5 DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 5 days served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges by 09-29-2016 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Court does not suspend driving privileges.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Court orders a $50.00 PR bond with turnover to JusticePoint.

Defendant Marquise M Smith in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Defendant Marquise M Smith in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant may has picked up a new case.  Review hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bench warrant served; original in file.  Case set for warrant return on 9-21-2015 at 8:30 am.  Attorney Reyes Cuevas notified by email.
Justice  Point discharge report, received and filed.

Attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Court previously issued a warrant for the defendant's non-compliance.   Defendant failed to appear for court.   Case remains in warrant status.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Marquise M Smith not in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Matter before court at state's request due to repeated non-compliance.  On state's motion, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  All parties notified, effective August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Carl Ashley, Branch 33, in room 113 in the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.
As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.

Defendant Marquise M Smith in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

The Court vacates stayed warrant.  Court reviewed the complaint and previously found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Review hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.    Defendant does not appear.  Defense request Court impose and stay a warrant.  State has no objection. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 310 Safety Building on 6/1/15 @ 1:30 pm
